question_text:
What value of c is a solution to the equation below?

c + 5 = 7
question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
solution: To find the solution, substitute each value of c into the equation c + 5 = 7.
Substitute the value c = 2 into the equation: 2 + 5 = 7
The value c = 2 makes this equation true. So, c = 2 is the solution.
Substitute the value c = 3 into the equation: 3 + 5 = 8, not 7. So, c = 3 is not a solution.

question_text: What value of x is a solution to the equation below?\n\nx + 7 = 27
question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
solution: To find the solution, substitute each value of x into the equation x + 7 = 27.
Substitute the value x = 20 into the equation: 20 + 7 = 27
The value x = 20 makes this equation true. So, x = 20 is the solution.
Substitute the value x = 19 into the equation: 19 + 7 = 26, not 27. So, x = 19 is not a solution.

question_text: What value of p is a solution to the equation below?\n\np + 5 = 10
question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
solution: To find the solution, substitute each value of p into the equation p + 5 = 10.
Substitute the value p = 7 into the equation: 7 + 5 = 12, not 10. So, p = 7 is not a solution.
Substitute the value p = 5 into the equation: 5 + 5 = 10
The value p = 5 makes this equation true. So, p = 5 is the solution.

question_text: What value of s is a solution to the equation below?\n\ns + 11 = 13
question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
solution: To find the solution, substitute each value of s into the equation s + 11 = 13.
Substitute the value s = 2 into the equation: 2 + 11 = 13
The value s = 2 makes this equation true. So, s = 2 is the solution.
Substitute the value s = 5 into the equation: 5 + 11 = 16, not 13. So, s = 5 is not a solution.

solution: To find the solution, substitute each value of y into the equation y + 2 = 19.

The value y = 17 makes this equation true. So, y = 17 is the solution.
